com.adobe.creativesdk.foundation.auth

Class AdobeUXAuthManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.adobe.creativesdk.foundation.auth.AdobeUXAuthManager

  • public final class AdobeUXAuthManager
extends java.lang.Object
    AdobeUXAuthManager manages Adobe Creative Cloud authentication, and is the starting point for using the Creative SDK.

    All clients are required to call the following methods before using the Creative SDK:

    • setAuthenticationParameters()
    • initWithApplicationContext()

    Using this class, you can:

    • Specify the Adobe-issued client ID and client secret.
    • Query for authentication status.
    • Get the user profile of the currently authenticated user.
    • Log out the currently logged in user.

    The AdobeUXAuthManager handles creating the UI for login and account creation automatically. Login data is cached such that when your application starts up, it can login automatically.

    Note that all Creative SDK APIs will require an authenticated user, so nearly all other classes will rely upon AdobeUXAuthManager.

    • Method Detail

      • getSharedAuthManager

        public static AdobeUXAuthManager getSharedAuthManager()
        Gets the shared instance of the AdobeUXAuthManager.
        Returns:
        shared instance of the AdobeUXAuthManager.

      • login

        public void login(AdobeAuthSessionLauncher sessionLauncher)
        Logs in the user.
        Parameters:
        sessionLauncher - the object containing information regarding the Android component which will be used to launch sign in Activity, if required. Also contains information regarding the Intent flags, request code, etc.

      • logout

        public void logout()
        Logs out the currently logged in user.

      • getUserProfile

        public AdobeAuthUserProfile getUserProfile()
        Gets the user profile of the currently logged in user.
        Returns:
        user profile of the currently logged in user or null if no user is currently logged in.

      • isAuthenticated

        public boolean isAuthenticated()
        Informs whether or not there is a currently logged in user.
        Returns:
        true if there is an authenticated user, false if there is no currently logged in user.

      • openContinuableAuthenticationEvent

        public void openContinuableAuthenticationEvent(AdobeAuthSessionLauncher sessionLauncher)
        Contact the authentication provider to open and handle the continuable error event. Typically this method is called when handling authentication events that require user interaction, e.g., email verification and terms of use updates. The code must be called on the main thread.
        Parameters:
        sessionLauncher - session launcher with error code of continuable error event which is to be handled
